revision.text: ==Turkish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|tr|ota|یانمق|tr=yanmak||to be burnt, suffer}}, from {{der|tr|trk-pro|*yan-||to burn (intr.), blaze up}}.<ref>{{R:tut-pro:SDM|*jan-|url=http://starling.rinet.ru/cgi-bin/response.cgi?single=1&basename=%2fdata%2falt%2fturcet&text_number=+151&root=config}}</ref> Cognate with {{cog|xqa||tr=yan-||to burn}}, {{cog|az|-}}, {{cog|crh|yanmaq||to burn}}, {{cog|ba|яныу||to burn}}, {{cog|cv|ҫунма||to burn, shine, worry, suffer}}, {{cog|kk|жану||to burn}}, {{cog|ky|жануу||to burn}}, {{cog|tk|ýanmak||to be burnt}}, {{cog|uz|yonmoq||to ignite, glow}}, {{cog|sah|сандаар||to shine}} (< caus. *jan-tɨr-). ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|tr|/jɑnˈmɑk/}} ===Verb=== {{tr-verb|yanar}} # {{lb|tr|intransitive}} to [[burn]], be on [[fire]]; to [[burn up]], [[burn down]] # {{lb|tr|intransitive}} to be [[burned]], [[scorched]], or [[singed]]; to get a burn or [[scald]]; to get [[sunburned]] # {{lb|tr|intransitive|for a place}} to be [[blazing]] [[hot]], be hot as blazes # {{lb|tr|intransitive}} to have [[fever]], be [[feverish]] # {{lb|tr|intransitive}} to [[smart]], [[suffer]] # {{lb|tr|intransitive}} to be in a [[bad]] [[predicament]], be [[sunk]], be [[done]] for, have had it; to get it in the neck; to be in the soup # {{lb|tr|intransitive}} to [[expire]]; to become [[void]] # {{lb|tr|intransitive|child language}} to be [[out]], be [[eliminated]] ## {{lb|tr|intransitive|child language|video games}} to [[die]], to [[lose]] ##: {{ux|tr|Sen '''yanınca''' sıra kardeşinde.|Your little brother will start playing '''when you lose'''.}} # {{lb|tr|intransitive|with dative case}} to feel great [[sadness]] (at); to feel [[bitter]] [[regret]] (for) # {{lb|tr|intransitive}} to be burning (with an emotion, a feeling), to have a burning desire (for). ====Conjugation==== {{tr-conj|yan|ı|yanar|a|d}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|tr|yanma|yanış|yanar|yanıcı|yanık|yangı|yandırmak|yanamamak|yanabilmek}} ===References=== <references/>
